definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: They do not provide word-for-word or literal interpretation, nor do you want them to do so.
sentences.chinese: 一名口譯員曾對我講過他被要求口譯證詞的事。

sentences.english: One interpreter handles American sign language.
sentences.chinese: 一個口譯員負責處理美國手語。

sentences.english: NO computer or any devices alike could replace interpretor.
sentences.chinese: 口譯員是任何電腦或翻譯設備所無法替代的。

sentences.english: Have you ever thought of being an interpreter someday?
sentences.chinese: 你有想過有一天做口譯員嗎？

sentences.english: Have a gift for languages, want to become an interpreter.
sentences.chinese: 有語言天賦，想成爲一名口譯員。

sentences.english: It is why even bilingual doctors rely on interpreters.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼就連雙語的醫生也要依賴於口譯員。

sentences.english: Lastly, strategies of knowledge structure construction are discussed in view of interpreters' practice.
sentences.chinese: 最後，結合實際探討口譯員的知識結構的構建策略。

sentences.english: It takes more than knowing two languages to be a good translator or interpreter.
sentences.chinese: 懂得兩種語言並不足以成爲一個優秀的筆譯或口譯員。

sentences.english: Their skills are tested the same way any other interpreter’s would be.
sentences.chinese: 他們的技能要和口譯員經過同樣的考覈。

sentences.english: This college prepares students as interpreters.
sentences.chinese: 這個學院培養學生當口譯員。

sentences.english: United Nations interpreters often have years of interpreting experience.
sentences.chinese: 聯合國口譯員通常有數年的口譯經驗。

sentences.english: While it is impossible to eliminate this format of questioning, attorneys should strive for simplicity in speech when an interpreter is used.
sentences.chinese: 但律師應在使用口譯員時儘量讓自己的講話簡潔清楚。
